Rcongas

Source: vignettes/Rcongas.Rmd
Rcongas.Rmd
library(Rcongas)
library(dplyr)

Analysis workflow

These data are required:

  • single-cell RNA or ATAC sequencing data from independent cells, in the form of counts per cell;
  • genome-wide segmentation with associated per-segment ploidy.

The formats of the inputs is discussed here.

The (R)CONGAS+ workflow consists in:

  • (optional) applying filters on the input data;
  • creating an (R)CONGAS+ object;
  • (optional) applying filters on the mapped data;
  • fitting a model

The package comes with input data to show what the required input formats are, and ready to use objects for case studies that we have discussed in the main papers; see References for details.

Input formats

# Example data available in the package
data('example_input')

RNA and ATAC have the same input format reporting:

  • chr, from and to: genomic locations of a gene (RNA) or a peak (ATAC)
  • cell: a cell identifier
  • value: the observed counts (discrete)
# RNA
example_input$rna %>% print()
#> # A tibble: 201,459 x 6
#>    gene     chr      from      to cell                                 value
#>    <chr>    <chr>   <int>   <int> <chr>                                <int>
#>  1 NOC2L    chr1   944203  959309 bcc.su008.pre.tumor_AAGGCAGTCACCGTAA     2
#>  2 AGRN     chr1  1020120 1056118 bcc.su008.pre.tumor_AAGGCAGTCACCGTAA     1
#>  3 SDF4     chr1  1216909 1232067 bcc.su008.pre.tumor_AAGGCAGTCACCGTAA     1
#>  4 ACAP3    chr1  1292390 1309609 bcc.su008.pre.tumor_AAGGCAGTCACCGTAA     2
#>  5 CPTP     chr1  1324756 1328896 bcc.su008.pre.tumor_AAGGCAGTCACCGTAA     1
#>  6 AURKAIP1 chr1  1373730 1375495 bcc.su008.pre.tumor_AAGGCAGTCACCGTAA     1
#>  7 CCNL2    chr1  1385711 1399335 bcc.su008.pre.tumor_AAGGCAGTCACCGTAA     2
#>  8 MRPL20   chr1  1401909 1407293 bcc.su008.pre.tumor_AAGGCAGTCACCGTAA     1
#>  9 CDK11B   chr1  1635225 1659012 bcc.su008.pre.tumor_AAGGCAGTCACCGTAA     1
#> 10 CDK11A   chr1  1702379 1724357 bcc.su008.pre.tumor_AAGGCAGTCACCGTAA     1
#> # … with 201,449 more rows

The gene column in the RNA dataset is required only to use some gene-based pre-processing filters discussed in the filtering vignette.

# ATAC
example_input$atac %>% print()
#> # A tibble: 581,807 x 5
#>    cell               value chr     from     to
#>    <chr>              <int> <chr>  <int>  <int>
#>  1 SU008_Tumor_Pre_45     1 chr1  127538 128038
#>  2 SU008_Tumor_Pre_45     2 chr1  540701 541201
#>  3 SU008_Tumor_Pre_45     4 chr1  762643 763143
#>  4 SU008_Tumor_Pre_45     3 chr1  859974 860474
#>  5 SU008_Tumor_Pre_45     1 chr1  866643 867143
#>  6 SU008_Tumor_Pre_45     2 chr1  871996 872496
#>  7 SU008_Tumor_Pre_45     2 chr1  876975 877475
#>  8 SU008_Tumor_Pre_45     3 chr1  894505 895005
#>  9 SU008_Tumor_Pre_45     2 chr1  895705 896205
#> 10 SU008_Tumor_Pre_45     1 chr1  898583 899083
#> # … with 581,797 more rows

Segments have this format:

  • chr, from and to: genomic range of the segment
  • copies: ploidy of each segment
example_input$segments %>% print()
#> # A tibble: 30 x 4
#>    chr        from        to copies
#>    <chr>     <int>     <int>  <int>
#>  1 chr10    285200 135490954      2
#>  2 chr4      40332 190986668      2
#>  3 chr11  17515668 134898011      3
#>  4 chr2  133074851 241531737      3
#>  5 chr2      39340  89319834      3
#>  6 chr14  20323479 105411153      3
#>  7 chr15  28947721 102517302      2
#>  8 chr6   67340783 171046023      2
#>  9 chr12  53343461 133801333      3
#> 10 chr5  110286431 180712485      3
#> # … with 20 more rows

Creation of a new dataset

Single-molecule assay (RNA)

Single-cell RNA, with z-score representation (Gaussian likelihood, "G") for the RNA counts.

x = init(
  rna = example_input$rna,
  atac = NULL,
  segmentation = example_input$segments,
  rna_likelihood = "G",
  description = 'SU008 sampled cells (example)')
#>                 ┌───────────────────────────────────────────────┐
#>                 │                                               │
#>                 │   (R)CONGAS+: SU008 sampled cells (example)   │
#>                 │                                               │
#>                 └───────────────────────────────────────────────┘
#> → Computing library size factors as total counts.
#> → Median digits per factor 5, scaling by 1e+05.
#>    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
#> 0.03423 0.09627 0.13736 0.15213 0.20357 0.34622
#> 
#> ── RNA modality (7.916976 Mb)
#> → Input events: 201459
#> → Input cells: 66
#> → Input locations: 11473
#> → Entries mapped: 125458, with 76001 outside input segments that will be discarded.
#> → Using likelihood: G.
#> ! Gaussian likelihood requires z-score representation of input values.
#> → Normalising RNA counts using input normalisation factors.
#> → Computing z-score.
#> ! With Gaussian likelihood normalisation factors are changed to 1.
#> ! There are 794 z-scores that are NA, will be removed.
#> # A tibble: 794 x 10
#>    gene  chr     from     to cell  value segment_id modality value_mean value_sd
#>    <chr> <chr>  <int>  <int> <chr> <dbl> <chr>      <chr>         <dbl>    <dbl>
#>  1 LRRI… chr12 8.50e7 8.53e7 bcc.…    NA chr12:533… RNA            7.26       NA
#>  2 CATS… chr15 4.36e7 4.37e7 bcc.…    NA chr15:289… RNA            7.26       NA
#>  3 MSGN1 chr2  1.78e7 1.78e7 bcc.…    NA chr2:3934… RNA            7.26       NA
#>  4 SLC4… chr2  7.42e7 7.43e7 bcc.…    NA chr2:3934… RNA            7.26       NA
#>  5 SHAN… chr22 5.07e7 5.07e7 bcc.…    NA chr22:246… RNA            7.26       NA
#>  6 B3GA… chr3  1.61e8 1.61e8 bcc.…    NA chr3:1298… RNA            7.26       NA
#>  7 ARHG… chr4  8.55e7 8.60e7 bcc.…    NA chr4:4033… RNA            7.26       NA
#>  8 RSPH… chr6  1.17e8 1.17e8 bcc.…    NA chr6:6734… RNA            7.26       NA
#>  9 MAN1… chr6  1.19e8 1.19e8 bcc.…    NA chr6:6734… RNA            7.26       NA
#> 10 MAFA  chr8  1.43e8 1.43e8 bcc.…    NA chr8:1020… RNA            7.26       NA
#> # … with 784 more rows
#> → Centering the new scores around input ploidy values.
#> 
#> ── Checking segmentation
#> ✓ Nothing to process.

S3 print method to visualise some information about the object

x %>% print
#> ── [ (R)CONGAS+ ] SU008 sampled cells (example) ────────────────────────────────
#> 
#> ── CNA segments (reference: GRCh38)
#> → Input 30 CNA segments, mean ploidy 3.2.
#> 
#>   | | |  | | | |  | | | |  | | |  | |  |   |  |  | 
#> 
#>   Ploidy:    0     1     2     3     4     5     *
#> 
#> ── Modalities
#> → RNA: 66 cells with 7401 mapped genes, 125458 non-zero values. Likelihood: Gaussian.
#> → ATAC: not available
#> ! Clusters: not available.
#> 
#> ──  LOG  ──
#> 
#> - 2021-04-03 13:03:00 Created input object.
#> [1] 0

Two-molecules assays (RNA and ATAC)

Joint single-cell RNA as above, but also single-cellATAC medeled with discrete likelihood for counts (Negative Binomial, "NB")

x = init(
  rna = example_input$rna,
  atac = example_input$atac,
  segmentation = example_input$segments,
  rna_likelihood = "G", 
  atac_likelihood = 'NB', # This is a count-based modality
  description = 'SU008 sampled cells (example)')
#>                 ┌───────────────────────────────────────────────┐
#>                 │                                               │
#>                 │   (R)CONGAS+: SU008 sampled cells (example)   │
#>                 │                                               │
#>                 └───────────────────────────────────────────────┘
#> → Computing library size factors as total counts.
#> → Median digits per factor 5, scaling by 1e+05.
#>    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
#> 0.03423 0.09627 0.13736 0.15213 0.20357 0.34622
#> → Computing library size factors as total counts.
#> → Median digits per factor 5, scaling by 1e+05.
#>    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
#> 0.04185 0.23245 0.30641 0.39151 0.56263 1.11517
#> 
#> ── RNA modality (7.916976 Mb)
#> → Input events: 201459
#> → Input cells: 66
#> → Input locations: 11473
#> → Entries mapped: 125458, with 76001 outside input segments that will be discarded.
#> → Using likelihood: G.
#> ! Gaussian likelihood requires z-score representation of input values.
#> → Normalising RNA counts using input normalisation factors.
#> → Computing z-score.
#> ! With Gaussian likelihood normalisation factors are changed to 1.
#> ! There are 794 z-scores that are NA, will be removed.
#> # A tibble: 794 x 10
#>    gene  chr     from     to cell  value segment_id modality value_mean value_sd
#>    <chr> <chr>  <int>  <int> <chr> <dbl> <chr>      <chr>         <dbl>    <dbl>
#>  1 LRRI… chr12 8.50e7 8.53e7 bcc.…    NA chr12:533… RNA            7.26       NA
#>  2 CATS… chr15 4.36e7 4.37e7 bcc.…    NA chr15:289… RNA            7.26       NA
#>  3 MSGN1 chr2  1.78e7 1.78e7 bcc.…    NA chr2:3934… RNA            7.26       NA
#>  4 SLC4… chr2  7.42e7 7.43e7 bcc.…    NA chr2:3934… RNA            7.26       NA
#>  5 SHAN… chr22 5.07e7 5.07e7 bcc.…    NA chr22:246… RNA            7.26       NA
#>  6 B3GA… chr3  1.61e8 1.61e8 bcc.…    NA chr3:1298… RNA            7.26       NA
#>  7 ARHG… chr4  8.55e7 8.60e7 bcc.…    NA chr4:4033… RNA            7.26       NA
#>  8 RSPH… chr6  1.17e8 1.17e8 bcc.…    NA chr6:6734… RNA            7.26       NA
#>  9 MAN1… chr6  1.19e8 1.19e8 bcc.…    NA chr6:6734… RNA            7.26       NA
#> 10 MAFA  chr8  1.43e8 1.43e8 bcc.…    NA chr8:1020… RNA            7.26       NA
#> # … with 784 more rows
#> → Centering the new scores around input ploidy values.
#> 
#> ── ATAC modality (16.30176 Mb)
#> → Input events: 581807
#> → Input cells: 34
#> → Input locations: 187509
#> → Entries mapped: 369456, with 212351 outside input segments that will be discarded.
#> → Using likelihood: NB.
#> 
#> ── Checking segmentation
#> ✓ Nothing to process.

The S3 print method reports the information about this object.

x %>% print
#> ── [ (R)CONGAS+ ] SU008 sampled cells (example) ────────────────────────────────
#> 
#> ── CNA segments (reference: GRCh38)
#> → Input 30 CNA segments, mean ploidy 3.2.
#> 
#>   | | |  | | | |  | | | |  | | |  | |  |   |  |  | 
#> 
#>   Ploidy:    0     1     2     3     4     5     *
#> 
#> ── Modalities
#> → RNA: 66 cells with 7401 mapped genes, 125458 non-zero values. Likelihood: Gaussian.
#> → ATAC: 34 cells with 123552 mapped peaks, 369456 non-zero values. Likelihood: Negative Binomial.
#> ! Clusters: not available.
#> 
#> ──  LOG  ──
#> 
#> - 2021-04-03 13:03:02 Created input object.
#> [1] 0

Datasets

RNA

# Breast-cancer PDX
data('campbell_bcpdx')
campbell_bcpdx %>% print
#> ── [ (R)CONGAS+ ] Campbell et al. Breast cancer PDX used in CONGAS ─────────────
#> 
#> ── CNA segments (reference: hg19)
#> → Input 70 CNA segments, mean ploidy 2.09.
#> 
#>       |   |   |    |  |  |  |   |    |   | |       |   | | |       |    |    |     |  |  |  
#> 
#>   Ploidy:    0     1     2     3     4     5     *
#> 
#> ── Modalities
#> → RNA: 497 cells with 8246 mapped genes, 1321676 non-zero values. Likelihood: Negative Binomial.
#> → ATAC: not available
#> ! Clusters: not available.
#> 
#> ──  LOG  ──
#> 
#> - 2021-04-01 15:09:50 Created input object.
#> - 2021-04-01 15:10:23 Filtered outliers: [14|0.03|0.97]
#> [1] 0

RNA and ATAC

# Basal cell carcinoma
data('satpathy_bcc')
satpathy_bcc %>% print
#> ── [ (R)CONGAS+ ] SU008 TUMOR 30 segments (73.66% genome) ──────────────────────
#> 
#> ── CNA segments (reference: GRCh38)
#> → Input 30 CNA segments, mean ploidy 3.2.
#> 
#>   | | |  | | | |  | | | |  | | |  | |  |   |  |  | 
#> 
#>   Ploidy:    0     1     2     3     4     5     *
#> 
#> ── Modalities
#> → RNA: 714 cells with 8613 mapped genes, 1401728 non-zero values. Likelihood: Negative Binomial.
#> → ATAC: 259 cells with 284316 mapped peaks, 3083691 non-zero values. Likelihood: Negative Binomial.
#> ! Clusters: not available.
#> 
#> ──  LOG  ──
#> 
#> - 2021-03-30 17:58:41 Created input object.
#> - 2021-03-30 17:58:43 Filtered outliers: [6|0.05|0.95]
#> [1] 0
